security_audit.summary: The skill includes download-and-execute install commands and a shell profile modification command. These patterns match high-risk execution and persistence behaviors even though they are presented as documentation.

critical_findings.title: Download and execute installer script
critical_findings.description: The skill instructs users to run a remote script via shell pipe, which is a download-and-execute pattern: "curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh".

critical_findings.title: Shell profile modification
critical_findings.description: The skill suggests appending to a shell rc file, which is a persistence mechanism pattern: "echo 'export PATH=\"$HOME/.cargo/bin:$PATH\"' >> ~/.bashrc".

critical_findings.title: Download and execute PowerShell installer
critical_findings.description: The skill instructs users to execute a remote PowerShell script, which is a download-and-execute pattern: "powershell -c \"irm https://astral.sh/uv/install.ps1 | iex\"".

dangerous_patterns.title: curl pipe to shell installer
dangerous_patterns.description: Remote script piped directly to shell can execute arbitrary code: curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh

dangerous_patterns.title: PowerShell remote execution
dangerous_patterns.description: Remote PowerShell script execution can run arbitrary code: powershell -c "irm https://astral.sh/uv/install.ps1 | iex"

dangerous_patterns.title: Shell profile modification
dangerous_patterns.description: Appending to shell rc file is a persistence mechanism: echo 'export PATH="$HOME/.cargo/bin:$PATH"' >> ~/.bashrc

content.user_title: Master uv for fast Python projects
content.value_statement: I need faster Python dependency management and simpler environments. This skill gives clear uv commands for projects, locks, and Python versions.
actual_capabilities: Initialize projects with `uv init` and standard files
Add, remove, and upgrade dependencies with `uv add` and `uv remove`
Create and use virtual environments with `uv venv` and `uv run`
Generate and update lockfiles with `uv lock` and `uv sync`
Install and pin Python versions with `uv python`
limitations: Does not install uv automatically; you must run the installer.
Examples assume a command line environment.
Network access is required for package downloads unless using offline mode.
Does not manage non Python system dependencies.

use_cases.title: Speed up local setup
use_cases.description: Start a new project quickly with uv init, dependency adds, and venv creation.

use_cases.title: Reproducible CI installs
use_cases.description: Use uv lock and uv sync --frozen to keep builds consistent and fast.

use_cases.title: Standardize tooling
use_cases.description: Adopt uv workflows for team projects and migration from pip or poetry.

prompt_templates.title: Beginner setup
prompt_templates.scenario: I am starting a new Python project
prompt_templates.prompt: Show the exact uv commands to create a project, add requests and pytest, and run tests without activating the venv.

prompt_templates.title: Dependency update
prompt_templates.scenario: I need to upgrade packages safely
prompt_templates.prompt: List uv commands to update all dependencies, refresh the lockfile, and check for outdated packages.

prompt_templates.title: Python version pin
prompt_templates.scenario: I need Python 3.12 for this project
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to install Python 3.12 with uv and pin it for the project.

prompt_templates.title: CI pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a uv based CI workflow that installs Python, syncs dependencies, and runs tests with frozen lockfiles.

output_examples.input: Give me the uv steps to create a project, add fastapi, and run tests.
output: Run `uv init my-app` and enter the directory
Add dependencies with `uv add fastapi` and `uv add --dev pytest`

best_practices: Commit uv.lock and pin Python versions.
Use `uv run` to avoid manual venv activation.
Use `uv sync --frozen` in CI for reproducibility.
anti_patterns: Using curl or PowerShell pipe installs from untrusted sources.
Skipping lockfiles in CI and relying on floating versions.
Mixing pip and uv installs without a clear workflow.

faq.question: Is it compatible with existing pyproject.toml files?
faq.answer: Yes, uv reads standard pyproject.toml and can work with existing projects.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It documents uv commands only and does not run tools or change your environment.

faq.question: Can I integrate it with CI and Docker?
faq.answer: Yes, it includes uv sync and lockfile workflows for CI and Docker builds.

faq.question: Does it access my files or data?
faq.answer: No, it is a static guide and does not read or transmit data.

faq.question: What should I try if uv is not found?
faq.answer: Check PATH settings or reinstall uv as shown in the troubleshooting section.

faq.question: How does it compare to pip or poetry?
faq.answer: It is faster and less opinionated while remaining compatible with pip workflows.
